data.title: Mentor Facebook 2022 — The Idea Village
data.text:
+ CHRIS LAIBE

Founder

inFRONT

Chris is the Founder and CEO of inFRONT, an Emergency Readiness software company that serves hazardous workplaces. He has extensive experience in the startups, enterprise sales, and business processes.

Areas of Expertise

Business Operations, Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Management/Human Resources, Enterprise Selling

[chris.laibe@infrontusa.com][0]

+ JACQUELINE TAYLOR

Senior UX Interaction Designer

GE Aviation

Jacqueline is a UX Designer who has worked at various startups in the New Orleans area for the past five years, including Spectrum Interactive, Radolo, and Align. She currently works for GE Aviation where she designs software used for jet engine repair. Jacqueline is currently the design lead for the digital maintenance repair and overhaul product suite. She is able to help companies with web and mobile application design, wire-framing, user testing, user journey mapping, personas, design thinking, and examining user problems.

Areas of Expertise

Design, Software Programming / Tech Development

jacqueline.e.taylor.14@gmail.com

+ LYDIA WINKLER

Co-founder and COO

RentCheck

Lydia is the founder of REEP Now (Relief Effort for Earning Parole) a nonprofit that provides parole advocacy and support to people in Louisiana. Prior to law school she lived in San Francisco where she worked for the Golden State Warriors and then for tech startup, Whistle (acquired by Mars). RentCheck is Lydia's third tech startup she's been a part of. Lydia holds a Juris Doctor and Masters in Business Administration from Tulane University.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Legal, Management/Human Resources, Marketing & Branding, Market Research, Public Relations

lydia@getrentcheck.com

+ NEIL KLEINBERG

Founder & CEO

GDiliVer

My day job is founder & CEO of DiliVer, an award-winning FinTech M&A due diligence software company. DiliVer is my 4th company to date. My second hat is as an adjunct professor at Johns Hopkins, Miami, and IE business schools, where I teach entrepreneurial finance, M&A, and have launched capstone/internship courses with local businesses. My third hat is as a mentor/advisor in 8 accelerators around the world.

Areas of Expertise

Banking, Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Data Analytics, Financial Modeling, Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Management/Human Resources, Marketing & Branding

neil.kleinberg@diliver.com

+ PATRICK BURTCHAELL

Product Designer

Facebook

I make software. In my career, I’ve worked as a product designer, a software engineer, and a founder of my own studio. Currently, I am a senior product designer at Facebook, working on privacy and end-to-end encryption for Facebook Messenger and Instagram; and a volunteer product designer at the U.S. Digital Response, helping governments and nonprofits deliver critical services. I have a B.Des and minor in HCI from Loyola University New Orleans.

Areas of Expertise

Design, General Business Strategy, Software Programming/Technology Development, Website Development

+ SAM FIHMA

Associate

LongueVue Capital

As an Associate at LongueVue Capital, Sam participates in both real review and transaction execution. Sam is primarily engaged in performing fundamental analysis for new opportunities, executing financial modeling and investment analysis for transactions, and providing operational support for portfolio company management.

Before joining LVC, Sam was a financial analyst in the Corporate Finance group at Duff & Phelps, where he focused on mergers and acquisitions, equity and debt private placements, and transaction opinions in the consumer and industrials sectors, as well as fairness and solvency opinions across a wide range of industries. Sam graduated magna cum laude with a BSM in finance from the A. B. Freeman School of Business at Tulane University.

Areas of Expertise

Banking, Financial Modeling, Fundraising & Investor Relations

samfihma@gmail.com

+ SOUMITRA SENGUPTA | EIR

Founder, Mentor, Investor, Executive

Soumitra has over 25 years of experience engineering products and leading teams in broad range of technology areas including Cloud Computing, Databases, Mobile Phones, AI and Robotics. At Microsoft, Soumitra was Director of Engineering for Platform, Tools and Personalization in the Microsoft Storefront team. During his 15 years at Microsoft, Soumitra worked on several “startup” initiatives including Azure, Power BI, Windows Phone and Hololens. Prior to Microsoft, Soumitra led product and engineering teams at Corio (acquired by IBM), B-Bop (acquired by Progress Software) where he was the co-founder, Philips Electronics. Soumitra started his engineering career and his first startup in New Orleans. Soumitra has several patents in Database, Cloud Computing, Computer Vision and Robotics. He received his Ph.D. from Tulane University, New Orleans, LA and Masters from Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India. Soumitra is passionate about innovation and building teams to solve complex problems. This has led Soumitra to investing in early-stage technology companies where aside from his investment, he enjoys working with, advising and mentoring entrepreneurs building products and companies.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Data Analytics, Design, Fundraising, Management, Market Research , Project Management, Software Programming, Website Development

soumitra.sengupta@ideavillage.org

+ TOMMY CAMPBELL

Principal Owner

Campbell Investment and Consulting

Tommy is an expert in developing and sustaining high-performance organizations by building team culture and guiding continuous improvement. His business acumen and diligence have lead domestic and international organizations to higher levels of success. Tommy worked at Iron Mountain, a Data and Records Management firm, for almost 18 years, serving in management roles as well as multiple SVP roles both national and internationally. Tommy also helped Co-Found the Lagniappe Angels, a capital angel investment group based in New Orleans, where he currently serves as the Executive Committee Chair.

Areas of Expertise

Executive Leadership, Change Management, Performance Improvement/KPI’s, International Operations, M&As, Technology Integration, Budgeting / Forecasting, Multi-Departmental Collaboration, Cost Control / ROI, Business Solutions, Quality Relationships, Sales Team Development, Restructures / Consolidations.

tommy.campbell@ideavillage.org

+ WILL SCOTT

CEO

Search Influence

Co-founder

UpScribed

Will has spent the last 25 years in digital media including co-founding this area's largest online marketing firm. In 14 years they grew Search Influence to nearly 100 employees with clients across the US and Canada. He has also launched a number of internal products in support of their operations.

He recently served on the board of the Louisiana Entrepreneurs' Organization as the Accelerator chair and is passionate about helping emerging businesses scale. Originally trained as an architect, he considers himself a professional problem solver.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Digital Marketing/SEO/Social Media, General Business Strategy, Marketing & Branding, Public Relations, Other

will@searchinfluence.com

+ DARRYL GLADE

CEO

IMOTO Photo and Rocket Photo

Originally from New Orleans, Darryl graduated from the University of Georgia with a B.B.A in risk management. He later returned to New Orleans and obtained his MBA from Loyola University New Orleans. After successfully establishing himself as a top Realtor in Louisiana, Darryl returned to Loyola University New Orleans Law School and obtained his law degree. During his second year of law school, Darryl co-founded IMOTO photo with Kris Haug. Over the next few years IMOTO expanded into new markets and quickly became an industry leader. Darryl is a founding member of the Association of Real Estate Photographers, a national association created to address the complicated digital media rights issue between the real estate industry and photographers. In 2017, Darryl co-founded Stilio with Hannah Huppi and Kris Haug. The team was interested in attacking the major issues and obstacles facing IMOTO. Ultimately, the team determined that it was the business model itself that was source of the issues. Creating Stilio using a different business model has allowed the team to take major steps forward in the real estate photography industry.

Areas of Expertise

General Business Strategy

darryl@imotophoto.com

+ DYLAN DIBONA

Partner

Monday and Partners

Dylan DiBona has over 20 years of experience working with new and established brands to help them express their reasons for existing in ways that are clear, authentic, and defensible. With practical experience that crosses all media Dylan brings a no-nonsense, practical approach to the work he does. Throughout his career his work has won awards but, more importantly, has consistently grown clients' businesses.

Areas of Expertise

Design, Digital Marketing/SEO/Social Media, Marketing & Branding, Website Development

dylan@mondayandpartners.com

+ JANE COOPER

Founder and Owner

Grande Krewe Fine Wine

Jane has founded and led 4 healthcare companies over the last 30 years, the most recent being a national healthcare advocacy and transparency company, which she started in 2001 and sold in 2017. In 2015 she joined 3 partners to open a local wine and spirits retail and event space in the Faubourg Marigny. She is an adjunct professor with AB Freeman at Tulane University and also lead a national healthcare consulting business.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Management/Human Resources, Marketing & Branding, Market Research, Project Management

redheadneworleans@gmail.com

+ KEVIN EDWARDS

Partner in the Customer Development Practice

The Partnering Group

Kevin is a former VP at Procter & Gamble of 22 years, where he also served in a GBLC capacity. He led businesses in most of the Americas, Central Europe, Eastern Europe, Western Europe and Asia. He was a Senior Vice President at Novartis and later led two entrepreneurial start-ups in the healthcare and food service space. Kevin’s expertise lies in go-to market strategy, innovation, customer and portfolio development, pricing and promotion and organization capability.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Data Analytics, Design, Financial Modeling, General Business Strategy, Management/Human Resources, Marketing & Branding, Market Research, Project Management

edwardskevin@mac.com

+ LEO HOLZENTHAL

President

M S Benbow and Associates

Leo is a professional engineering with 30+ years of experience in the consulting engineering (Professional services) business. He is also an Adjunct professor at UNO in ME and EE, an Angel Investor, and qualified private capital investor. He has been president of MSB for over 20 years and has mentored many entrepreneurs in small and medium businesses. He is currently a mentor in the Lowe Foundation American Academy of Entrepreneurs program.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Data Analytics, Design, General Business Strategy, Management/Human Resources, Project Management

llholzen@msbenbow.com

+ NICHOLAS CALLAIS

Managing Partner, CFO & CCO

Callais Capital Management

Nick serves as Managing Partner, CFO & CCO for Callais Capital Management, a venture capital and private equity asset management firm based in Louisiana that has invested over 150m in private transactions over the past 5 years. Nick oversees the firm’s operations including accounting, compliance, finance, tax, risk management, loan operations, IT, tax, and investor relation functions. He is a board member for Pelican Waste & Debris, Louisiana's #1 fastest growth company in 2018 and #3 in LA for 2019 on the Inc5000. Nick graduated with a B.A. and MBA from Tulane University and lives in the Warehouse District in New Orleans.

Areas of Expertise

Accounting/Bookkeeping, Banking, Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Digital Marketing/SEO/Social Media, Financial Modeling, Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Insurance, Legal, Management/Human Resources, Public Relations

nick@callaiscapital.com

+ PATRICK COMER

Founder and CEO

Lucid

Since 1998, Patrick Comer has been a founder, investor, and executive for startups. He founded Lucid with a vision to democratize data collection by applying programmatic technology to market research. Lucid is now the world-wide leader in enterprise marketplaces for sampling. Since its inception in 2010, Lucid has become one of the most successful tech startups in New Orleans, with hundreds of employees across the globe.

Patrick was named Tulane Distinguished Entrepreneur of the Year by the A.B. Freeman School of Business. In 2018, the New Orleans Times-Picayune listed him as one of the city’s most important figures in the “300 for 300” project. Patrick holds a BA from Sewanee and an MBA from Columbia Business School.

pcomer@luc.id

+ ROBBIE VITRANO

CEO

Innisfree

Journalist to advertising/branding to founder to investor/mentor. Designer in sum. Robbie founded companies in media, marketing, and food with an emphasis on social entrepreneurship and conscious capitalism.

Robbie was founder and CEO of Trumpet, a branding studio. This venture expanded to include an investment fund and accelerator which launched The Idea Village (Co-founder), New Orleans' first co-working space, and planning catalyst of multiple post-Katrina initiatives (ie. public safety, health, education, media). More recently he is focused on organic/natural food (CEO Good Spread, investor Uncanny, Natch, New Barn, I.E. Mills) with an emphasis on CPG, and regenerative agricultural supply chain. Robbie splits his time between Boulder, Colorado and New Orleans.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Design, General Business Strategy, Marketing & Branding, Other

robbie@trumpetgroup.com

+ ALFREDO SANCHEZ

RVP, Sales

Litify

Throughout my career in finance, tech, and as an advisor/investor in startups, I have always been passionate about discovering new ways to help people and companies find solutions to their business challenges, in turn, helping the world evolve. Over the past 15 years I have been fortunate to have worked in New York City with highly talented professionals at transformational companies like Thomson Reuters, Bloomberg L.P., and LinkedIn.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development + Sales, Diversity, Equity, + Inclusion, Management/Human Resources

+ BROOK BISSINGER

Director of Operations, Sales and Customer Success

Align Technologies Corp.

Brook has been drawn to operations throughout her entire career, even if hrt official position was in marketing or fundraising. As one of the first 15 employees at Lucid, she built scalable processes for project management and customer success as they grew, culminating with opening the London office in 2016. In the past 18 months at Align she led the sales department, creating thought out processes and changing business and pricing models as needed. In addition, Align now has a solid customer success process with an onboarding course and measurable success.

Areas of Expertise

Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Management/Human Resources, Project Management

brook5280@gmail.com

+ KIRK COCO

Director of Account Management and Sales

NOLA Brewing

US Naval Officer who transitioned to Entrepreneurship, founding NOLA Brewing Company and NOLA Distilling Company. I have brought a concept from napkin idea to fully developed successful $4.5 million/year revenue company, and also started a company and failed three years in. Both of these experiences gave me a unique knowledge base of both success and failure in the entrepreneurship arena.

Areas of Expertise

Data Analytics, Financial Modeling, Fundraising, Management, Project Management

kirkcoco@me.com

+ LESLIE CAMPISI

Consultant

Fractional CMO

Leslie has 20+ years working in the global tech ecosystem, in-house at startups, in tech PR, and in VC. She is a marketer with deep experience in brand, corporate communications, and editorial strategy. She is also an entrepreneur & operator who has launched and run agencies. She is based in NYC with deep networks in London and SF and in the fintech sector. She is a tech generalist having worked across B2B, B2C, B2B2C, and nearly every vertical. She is enthusiastic about working with female and BIPOC founders, as well as companies building new business models. This includes those truly re-engineering the way a process or system works vs. just improving UX. She is also excited about working with businesses with B2B and B2C ambitions, mission-driven founders and companies and first-time entrepreneurs.

lesliecampisi@gmail.com

+ PETER LIU | IIR

Vice President

Pritzker Group Venture Capital

Peter is a Vice President at Pritzker Group Venture Capital, where he is responsible for sourcing investments across the firm’s enterprise and consumer sectors. Peter has worked in the firm’s Chicago and Los Angeles offices, the latter of which he helped build out in 2016. Peter is an active participant in the national venture capital community, having founded VentureUP, the top Midwest network for emerging venture capitalists and a member of Kauffman Fellows, a premier innovation, leadership and venture capital-focused program.

Areas of Expertise

Business Modeling, Fundraising & Investor Relations, Financial Modeling, General Business Strategy

peter@revelry.co

+ ROBIN BARNES

Principal

Resilience Resolutions

Robin’s experience spans both the practice and policy of recovery and resilience—from “boots on the ground” technical assistance work with small businesses rebuilding across New York City after 9/11, to developing a gold-standard post-Katrina small business recovery program for Gulf Coast fisheries, to writing the chapter on small business and entrepreneurship for President Obama’s Hurricane Sandy Rebuilding Strategy. As EVP and COO at Greater New Orleans, Inc., for nearly a decade, Robin operated at the intersections of practice and policy and environment and economics and has overseen several major initiatives designed to create and protect jobs in the region and to turn environmental threats into economic opportunity and job creation, including the creation of the Greater New Orleans Urban Water Plan, a roadmap to guide policymakers, public and private leaders, businesses, and community stakeholders through improved management of stormwater, subsidence, and other threats of climate change. Now, Robin's consulting engagements are focussed largely on small business and economic resilience where she advises philanthropy, higher education, NGOs and economic development organizations on strategies for small businesses to adapt to environmental and economic threats and opportunities to generate revenues and jobs and contribute to community and economic development.

Robin is a faculty member of the Tulane University School of Professional Advancement Masters of Public Administration Program. She is a Director of the Sewerage & Water Board of New Orleans, a Commissioner of the Governor’s (Louisiana) Advisory Commission on Coastal Protection, Restoration and Conservation, and Chair of the Board of Coastal Communities Consulting, Inc.

Robin is a born and bred New Yorker who has been living in New Orleans since 2006.

robin@resilienceresolutions.com

+ SANJEEV AGRAWAL

President and COO

LeanTaas

Sanjeev serves as the President and Chief Operating Officer for LeanTaaS the leading ML platform for healthcare operations. Sanjeev was Google’s first Head of Product Marketing. Since then, he has led three successful startups - CEO at Aloqa (acquired by Motorola), VP Products & Marketing at TellMe Networks (acquired by Microsoft) and Founder & CEO at Collegefeed (acquired by AfterCollege).

Sanjeev graduated Phi Beta Kappa with BS and MS degrees in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from MIT. He started his career at McKinsey & Company and Cisco Systems before joining Google. Sanjeev is a Forbes contributor and also writes on his personal blog at http://medium.com/@saagrawa. He is an avid squash player and has been named by Becker's Hospital Review as one of the top entrepreneurs innovating in Healthcare.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Data Analytics, Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Marketing & Branding, Public Relations

sanjeev1969@gmail.com

+ ANDRE CHAMPAGNE

Founder and CEO

Passcode Entertainment

Andre is an entrepreneur, accomplished speaker, inventor, and international business executive who brings over 15 years of expertise in the environmentally-friendly film transportation, film production, and finance sectors to Passcode Entertainment.

Prior to joining the Passcode team, Andre was the founder and CEO of Hollywood Trucks, a full service, eco-friendly, entertainment fleet. The company began in 2008 with seven vehicles and under his guidance, grew to more than six offices with 400 vehicles. Andre graduated with a B.S. from Louisiana State University where he was asked to give its commencement address in 2012.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Legal, Marketing & Branding, Market Research, Other

andre.champagne@passcodeentertainment.com

+ EDWIN BRAGG

Founder

Bragg Marketing

Edwin is the founder of Bragg Marketing, where he consults for emerging and established businesses. He has led the global marketing and communications for several leading brands including Shake Shack, GQ and local eyewear brand Krewe. He headed up branding, digital, social, growth marketing, events, CRM/guest experience, advertising and communications strategies, and helped successfully scale and take Shake Shack public on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE). A graduate of Tulane University, Edwin holds an MBA in Marketing from Georgia State University.

Areas of Expertise

Digital Marketing/SEO/Social Media, Marketing + Branding, Market Research, Public Relations, Website Development, Project Management across Hospitality, Retail, Fashion and Consumer Products.

+ JOHN MARSHALL

Founder

Series Next Solutions

John's most recent position before founding Series Next Solutions was a COO role at a growing startup, so he has seen the process first-hand of going from having the model in place, to building the infrastructure to scale, to surviving a due diligence process by a buyer. John's deepest background and skills are in business intelligence, digital transformation (using cloud software to build a scalable organization), and financial planning and analysis.

Areas of Expertise

Accounting/Bookkeeping, Business Modeling, Data Analytics, Financial Modeling, Software Programming/Technology Development, Other

john.marshall@seriesnextsolutions.com

+ JUSTIN WOHLSTADTER | EIR

Founder & CEO

Waldo.fyi

Founder & CEO of Waldo.fyi, where we're building a better Google search, for work. Before that was Founder & CEO of AskWonder.com, the largest on-demand desk research service, powered by a hive mind of brilliant research analysts around the world. Before founding AskWonder.com, served as the Director of Product Design for Divide (acquired by Google) out of their New York, Hong Kong, and London offices. Prior to that, co-founded BOLDstart Ventures, where I led or co-led investments in Divide, GoInstant (acquired by Salesforce), Klout (acquired by Lithium), Rapportive (acquired by LinkedIn), Blaze (acquired by Akamai), ThinkNear (acquired by Telenav), IndieGoGo, and Yipit, among others. Attended Harvard University and Oxford University, writing my master's dissertation on how the Internet will affect access to higher education.

Areas of Expertise

Business Development & Sales, Business Modeling, Data Analytics, Design, Financial Modeling, Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Legal, Management/Human Resources, Market Research, Project Management, Software Programming/Technology Development, Website Development

justin@waldo.fyi

+ LOUISA SMITH

Managing Director

NO/LA Angel Network

Louisa is the Managing Director of the NO/LA Angel Network (NO/LAAN), a New Orleans based network of over 120 accredited Angel Investors. Since the network’s inception in 2014, NO/LAAN members have invested over $10M in early-stage companies while helping entrepreneurs grow businesses through fundraising, mentoring, and networking. Louisa is responsible for leading NO/LAAN’s operations and deal flow activity, including due diligence, syndication, and portfolio management. In addition to her role as Managing Director at NO/LAAN, Louisa also serves as the Manager of The Pelican Angel Fund. She earned an MBA with a concentration in finance from Tulane’s A B Freeman School of Business after receiving her BA, Cum Laude, from Tulane in 2012.

louisa@nolaangelnetwork.org

+ MAURICIO PRIETO

Partner

Travel Tech Essentialist

Maurio is the co-founder, former CMO and board member of eDreams Odigeo from 1999 to 2015. Odigeo grew to become the 3rd largest online travel company with USD$5.5 billion gross bookings, $550 million revenue, $140 million EBITDA, and eventually went public in 2014. Currently, he is doing independent consulting in various projects in the online travel industry. Mauricio’s expertise is focused in the travel and hospitality industries, and is willing to help out in general with B2C startups across industries.

mprieto@gmail.com

+ RUPA MOHAN

Founder and Chief Product Officer

The Sweat Social LLC

Rupa has a background in corporate finance and spent 10-years on Wall Street before she left to pursue her passion for health and wellness. She started The Sweat Social almost 6 years ago and since then has scaled her business to a corporate audience and expanded to a global client base. The Sweat Social is in the health and wellness industry, but she also has a background in Corporate Finance, working in the Pharmaceutical industry as well as the Financial Services industry.

+ WILL LOVETT

Co-CEO

TrayAway

For the past 5 years, Will has built two SaaS startups from the ground up, starting with ForecastRx (a predictive analytics engine for small business purchasing) and currently at TrayAway, the leader in hotel room service management and tracking. His roles have been mostly tech focused, crafting enterprise-level applications with robust, scalable back-end architectures. Additionally, as in most startups, he’s been involved with almost all facets: financials, research and development, fund raising, business processes, etc.

Areas of Expertise

Fundraising & Investor Relations, General Business Strategy, Project Management, Software Programming/Technology Development, Other

will@trayaway.com
